meet_at_my_place_to_.jcr:description:
This one is for the diehards! We’re headed out to the Columbia River Gorge for a 5 night, 60-mile hike. We ask that if you decide to join this hike, you have hiked at least 3 days carrying all your gear and food. This is a difficult hike, so if you are considering joining, please grab a topo map and give the trail a good review before you make your final decision.
I would like to look into scheduling at least three meet-ups before hand so we can discuss gear, safety, etc. Let me know if you’re interested.
meet_at_my_place_to_.jcr:title: Meet at my place to hit the road

slaughter_canyon_cav.jcr:description:
I would like to get a group together to hike Slaughter Canyon Cave at Carlsbad. It is a strenuous hike, but it should only take us about 2 hours. From there you can explore, enjoy the park, and do pretty much whatever you want.
Since it’s in a national park, there are strict hike times—we need to be there ready to go at 8:00am. Also, there is a 25-person limit to each group, so it is a first-come-first-serve event. Let me know if you’re interested.
slaughter_canyon_cav.jcr:title: Slaughter Canyon Cave

hiker_s_corner_.jcr:description:
This month, we will be discussing avalanche safety. The snow season is just around the corner, and I know a lot of you really enjoy snowshoeing, so let’s all prepare for a safe season.
We will discuss common warning signs of an avalanche and what to do if you are caught in one, and we will also go through a first aid/CPR refresher.
hiker_s_corner_.jcr:title: Hiker’s Corner

movie_night_the_moun.jcr:description: The Superplex is showing The Mountain for their Saturday Throwback movie this month. For those of you who don’t know, this 1956 classic is about two brother who hike a mountain to the site of a plane crash, but each brother has their own motives. Suspenseful. Fun. Don’t miss out.
movie_night_the_moun.jcr:title: Movie Night: The Mountain

hiker_community_food.jcr:description:
Hey everyone, hope you’re all doing well. As we look forward to the holiday season, I think it would be a great idea to all pitch in and help out those in need. Even if we aren’t rich and glamorous, a few cans of food here and there, or maybe an old jacket or blanket that you won’t use anymore can go a long way toward helping brighten someone else’s day.
My family and I will be posted up at the library pretty much all day long, so please fell free to stop by whenever you get a moment.
hiker_community_food.jcr:title: Hiker community food drive
